DOC.HEAD: Text of Vatican Statement on Negotiations Over Noriega
DOC.TEXT: The following is the text of a statement issued Saturday at the Vatican regarding former Panamanian leader Manuel Noriega. The statement was translated from Italian by The Associated Press. Regarding the case of Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega, who took refuge in recent days in the apostolic nunciature of Panama, the Secretariat of State declares: In the course of the consultations that have taken place in recent days between the Holy See and U.S. authorities over the case of Gen. Noriega, the two parties have agreed to continue to remain in close contact to examine together, in a spirit of serene collaboration, the various aspects of the complex case and the possibility of arriving at a just solution which will be mutually satisfactory, keeping in mind that, in receiving Mr. Noriega in the apostolic nunciature, the apostolic nuncio did not intend to block the course of justice regarding a person accused of serious crimes, but to promote the end of a conflict that in previous days had caused so much destruction and so many victims, and could have gone on indefinitely in the form of guerrilla warfare.''
